website_summaries.verdict: This cross-trainer from Nike makes the middle ground between the agility of a Free shoe and the stability of a Metcon. It should be noted though that what makes this footwear versatile also detracts from its ability to serve as a dedicated lifter or runner. But if you are in search of a trainer to do a little bit of everything at the gym, then it’s an option to consider.
pros: The overwhelming majority of users find this model a perfect blend of a running shoe and a cross-trainer
It accommodates jumps, short-distance runs, and moderate weightlifting
Many buyers have enjoyed the comfort offered by this pair of training shoes
It is described to have a snug, glove-like fit, based on a myriad of comments
The shoe’s design has been considered as aesthetically pleasing by most users
Multiple wearers have expressed satisfaction with the trainer’s lightweight nature
cons: More than a few purchasers have reported that the shoe produces a squeaky noise when worn
Some people find it unsuitable for heavier lifts or longer runs

customer_reviews.title: Don’t EVER BUY 3rd PARTY!!! Alpha Co-thumbs down.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes were slim ordered normal size did not fit comfortably. Nice shoe but the quality was questionable. Glue was really visible, reminded me of Ross quality shoes. Not only that but I bought 3rd party and they had me pay for the shipping AND took 20% of the cost. Meaning I paid $114 for a pair of shoes that was low quality and didn’t fit. I paid $14 for shipping and they only refunded me $87 dollars. I only got $73 for a pair of shoes that didn’t fit and we low quality. I don’t understand why Amazon even works with 3rd party companies like these. The company was ALPHA CO.
customer_reviews.author: SincerelySelene

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Just over one month old of wearing 3-4 times a week for basement workouts (Tony Horton, Sagi stuff) and one of the treads is already coming off...not a good sign. Up until today, I loved them. Very stabile, comfortable, and yes "squeaky"... but who really cares about that. However, I can't believe the lack of durability a 42 year old exposed doing onge month of basement workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Dave G.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for gym work. Shoe is a bit squeeky when walking
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for gym work. Stable for squats and deadlifts etc. Light and responsive for kettlebell flows and workouts. Shoe is a bit squeeky when walking
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky shoes
customer_reviews.text: The shoes squeak a lot when walking across any surface. It seems it has something to do with the stretchy canvas of the shoe. I thought it would go away with time but it hasn't. Also the canvas of the shoe is a bit of a sponge so it soaks up and holds onto sweat. Which means as my main gym shoe I am washing them weekly. 1st time I've ever had to do this with a shoe.
customer_reviews.author: usforus

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for HIIT workouts
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of the first generation of Nike Free MetCon and these are much better. The fit is more snug and comfortable. I was stepping out of the first generation. These shoes are specifically designed for HIIT workouts. The reviews about them not being good for walking or distance running are by people who didn’t understand what they were buying. They provide great stability for HIIT and do the job for short runs. I like that these have a thicker sole than some other HIIT shoes because I need the support that nano style shoes don’t have.
customer_reviews.author: pdeldc

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: These are so stylish and different. My husband loves them and says they’re comfortable. In the pictures it looks like there’s no laces to be tied up too but there is. Still awesome shoes, I am sure he can tuck them in.
customer_reviews.author: N. Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: It’s an alright shoe. Stylish though. Just noisy.
customer_reviews.text: My left shoe doesn’t make “rubber” sounding noises when I step, but my right one is obnoxiously loud, and shoe laces come undone easily. It definitely sizes a little different then expected, but it it has a firm hold. Nice colors. Just not happy with the noise it makes. And I’m a high arch foot with normal width foot.
customer_reviews.author: pjt44

customer_reviews.title: Nice casual and training shoes
customer_reviews.text: These tennis are really nice and flexible, which means that they are not only for training but also for casual outfits, so fits into multiple purposes, and of course more much better than using tennis shoes for running, which sometimes are not really useful when it comes to lift weight
customer_reviews.author: BVP

customer_reviews.title: Get these for weight work. Stability
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for CrossFit or functional fit routines and exercise. Wide toe box. A bit stiff. They’re ok for short runs. A little hard to land in, but are rock solid stable for squats, and cleans, and dead lift type movements.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron L. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Perfect color and Fit
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for green shoes that were this exact color. I wasn’t having any luck at all until I found these and they are PERFECT. These shoes are exactly what I was looking for in the exact color, style and fit
customer_reviews.author: Jacque Lagomarsino

customer_reviews.title: Everything but shuttle runs so far
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is good for stationary, jumping, running, and lifting movements. It does not have a lot of side support for shuttle runs, where you may be stopping in a lateral direction.
customer_reviews.author: M. N.

customer_reviews.title: Shoe comfort
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is difficult to put on but once they’re on the comfort grows on you...
customer_reviews.author: Richard M.

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable pair of shoes
customer_reviews.text: It has a lump bulging on the left pair on the ball just behind your big toe. It was very uncomfortable. Seems like it’s not a legit nike product. I’ve been using nike for a long time, and I have never ever experienced something like this from a nike foot wear. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron K.

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for your achilles when running in them.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first shoe I've ever owned that destroyed my achilles heels while running in it. I wear a 13 and I got a 13 and after one 3 mile run my heels were pretty bad. I also felt that it lacked the stability for me personally to snatch in. I think this shoe tries too hard to do everything and succeeds at nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Dav1x

customer_reviews.title: A superb cross trainer
customer_reviews.text: I work out running trails several times a week for 2 months now. They are performing exceptionally well. Light, comfortable and fairly stable given their low profile. Superb cross trainer.
customer_reviews.author: John G. Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Great training shoe for weights and cardio.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite new shoes. Great for weight training and for short/medium runs/cardio. Actually played tennis in them too, but not ideal. Perfect fit and foot stability. Great design with only flaw being that they squeak a little when walking. Not something you notice during a workout...just when walking down a quiet hallway to the changing room.
customer_reviews.author: James Chuck

customer_reviews.title: They Talk To You.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for training but just like others have noted this sneaker makes so much noise. It skids on floors and squeaks. Everything else about it is great though, especially for the purpose of training.
customer_reviews.author: MudVirus

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and the shoes offer more support than I thought. Great for working out as well as all around "wear all day" shoes. Plus they look great and have received many complements on these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny5

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in great shape in the original box (important to me)
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for working out in an old school gym, no slipping and firm support. However, with a high arch the shoe is a hard effort to squeeze your foot in without a shoe-horn.
customer_reviews.author: Skychief9

customer_reviews.title: All I could ask for!
customer_reviews.text: On time delivery, nice packaging, no issues with the product, nothing more I could ask for! Shoes look great and are awesome for the gym/indoor sports (I play badminton). Highly recommend if you’re looking for shoes for these types of activities. I bought these 1/2 a size smaller than I normally wear, I wanted them to be tight for sports.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Needs more ankle support
customer_reviews.text: Overall good shoes for gym workout. Good support over bridge of foot. Bot too good for ankle support so.not for people that like running on a treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: Hush

customer_reviews.title: Trainer Shoe and Fits Snug
customer_reviews.text: I like the snug fir and the shoes are very comfortable. Like most shoes, it will take some time to break them in and slipping my feet into the shoes is becoming easier. I thought it was a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit me
customer_reviews.text: I love how flexible these are. no blisters on the balls of my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Motor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Nike
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes. No need to tie. Fits tightly. Like metcon free x original. Not a fan of the color fully but it’s the color I ordered. Fast delivery. Great shoes for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Best lifting shoe I ever had! Surprised they fit so well considering I bought them online but I wasn’t disappointed at all. Had them for 30 days now with no noticeable damage/problems at all
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel

customer_reviews.title: Mixed review.
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty comfortable pair of shoes. Functional to an extent. Not able to tie them tight enough and certain work outs with lateral movements and the heel of the shoe shifts. Suggest buying a size smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Roig

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe and feels comfortable. Shoe does squeak some depending on what socks I’m wearing
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky shoes
customer_reviews.text: fits as expected but makes a lot of noise when I'm walking around gym.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but I returned them
customer_reviews.text: Shoe looked great and was comfortable, but for this revision, the back part of the show went up high against my Achilles’ tendon so I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: KJD

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but SQUEAKY
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had Nike Metcons in the past and loved them these shoes are comfortable but squeak when you walk. I thought the squeak would subside as I broke them in but after more than a month of wearing them, they haven’t stopped.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and great support
customer_reviews.text: Nike has finally mastered where to put more sole support when you run or jog, where you land. Great shoe and the looks, I get so many likes.
customer_reviews.author: Marilen Araneta

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky! But stylish
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are VERY squeaky and will not stop squeaking once they’re worn in. Every step the plastic piece that the laces loop through rub against the synthetic material. I’d return the shoes but I look really good in them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get a size bigger
customer_reviews.text: Was listed as true to size but isn’t. All my other Nike metcons are size 9 and fit accordingly. Comfortable if you have the right size. Just have to run them a size up. Disappointed the the size doesn’t correlate with other Metcons.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrick

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: Hi, This shoe does not fit. I've always worn a 9 in a Nike, but this puppy is just to small. I've worn it twice and bad blisters both times and my toe is touching the end. I purchased a size 9.5 today. Can I please return this item?
customer_reviews.author: Robert Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Attractive
customer_reviews.text: Love it, attractive but a bit tight for the size though.
customer_reviews.author: Adjaye

customer_reviews.title: Worth it just don’t run in them at all
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not for running but comfortable for weights and any HIT workouts
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Kuhl

customer_reviews.title: Noisey but I would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Great order, shipping and condition perfect. As for the shoes, they squeak because of the neoprene on plastic.. part of the shoe design. Aside from that I am delighted with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: shaun

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but the squeak like a squeaktoy
customer_reviews.text: Love the look, they are replacing my Presto. Nice, but the squeak like a squeak toy
customer_reviews.author: Mister T.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I’m using these shoes for CrossFit workouts and I couldn’t be happier with my purchase. They fit great and are super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Gahring

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are not made well.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes tore up about a week after my son wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: William Teddy Dwight III

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Shoe fits and and looks as advertised. But it’s a little noisey at first. Maybe after they are broken in they’ll lose the squeaking sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Tareq ElSadi

customer_reviews.title: Thank you
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time ordering a piece of footwear off amazon and to my surprise it fit like a glove!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Karum

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I’m a gym rat and I love um You can leave them tied and just slip them on If I had any complaint, they aren’t super well ventilated
customer_reviews.author: matt wienczak

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and working shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe was great for my Les Mills Classes. I do quite a bit of cross training and this shoe was effective and good looking!
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Good for Working Out
customer_reviews.text: 4th pair of Metcon. Great for working out. Fit as expected.
customer_reviews.author: k.Mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, but very loud.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are supportive and feel good on my feet, but they are very squeaky. It’s almost outrageous.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Arnzen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very nice show,at 1st though was tight but it just hugs your foot perfectly, very comfortable working out in these
customer_reviews.author: jeff Crutcher

customer_reviews.title: Very good, stable shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Used for cross-training and it's done a fantastic job. I'm a bigger guy and it helps with stability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are one of the most comfortable "cross-fit" shoes i've worn. They hug your feet.
customer_reviews.author: james rabalais

customer_reviews.title: True to size
customer_reviews.text: The fit perfect, are stylish and comfortable. I am very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shafike

customer_reviews.title: Great but noisy
customer_reviews.text: They are a bit noisy, rubber part rubs against neoprene fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Aguirre

customer_reviews.title: A tumb up!
customer_reviews.text: A durable sole; a good snug fit... great sneaker for the price
customer_reviews.author: Victor Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Good,  but squeaky...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe. I use it for the gym and to go out. Only con is that it squeaks. Not sure why..
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable and excellent fit
customer_reviews.text: Very good combination of overall support, light weight and excellent traction. Appears also to be highly adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: James Naples

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! I wear for CrossFit and heavy lifting. They are great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Walkers Bluff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for running and oly lifts
customer_reviews.text: Great cross trainer, good flexion when running and great stability during oly lifts.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Weight lifting shoes only.
customer_reviews.text: They’re too stiff and should be listed as squat/deadlift shoes instead of training.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie.Gwaltney

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: They look great but not as comfortable as other Nike shoes I have.
customer_reviews.author: Furk

customer_reviews.title: Metcon
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic training shoe for the gym! I love these shoes and would highly recommend them to someone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 star
customer_reviews.text: Just as described and what you would expect from the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Nike
customer_reviews.text: I loved these shoes. They fit perfectly and look great.
customer_reviews.author: Alonso Robles

product_meta.title: Nike Men's Free Metcon 2 Running Shoe
